  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal jerricans in doublewall corrugated carton with integrated corrugated divider flaps. Loos caps on two jerricans allowed leakage which damaged adhesives of tape and labels and soiled carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023120084
item.description:
Report E-2023120084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 28, 2023, two (2) 330-gallon totes of UN3266 were damaged in transit by over-stacked freight and released approximately four (4) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed decontaminate and absorbent pads to the release and containerized the impacted pads in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal. The two (2) damaged totes were transferred into a new set of drums for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2023120039
item.description:
Report E-2023120039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 9, 2023 a trailer in temporary storage at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson Colorado was observed to be smoking. The dock area was immediately evacuated and the Veolia emergency response team evaluated the situation. Further investigation revealed a 55 gallon drum containing inner containers of hydrochloric acid and alkyl sulfonic acid was improperly packed. The container of sulfonic acid shifted and fell on its side during transportation resulting in a release of material which mixed with the hydrochloric acid causing a reaction and vapor release. The Veolia ER team repacked the material into two separate containers - one containing the hydrochloric acid and one containing only the alkyl sulfonic acid. The alkyl sulfonic acid drum was reloaded on the rear of the vehicle for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived to station wet because of internal leakage. Package discovered during unloading from trailer. Gloves used to remove from trailer and put into plastic bag and tote. DescribePack: Loose cap discovered to be the issue. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package Handler discovered package during unloading trailer and informs manager. Manager informs QA. Gloves used to remove package from trailer and put into plastic bag and tote. QA searched for SDS and clean up spillage. Not enough to leak out to effect other package from this release liquid absorbed into outer container.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: SHIPMENT WAS FOUND IN TRAILER WET DURING UNLOADING AROUND 8:30AM. SHIPMENT WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: PACKAGE LEAKED DUE TO LOOSE CAPS AND INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING (NO INNER PACKING). THERE WAS ABOUT 4OZ THAT LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINERS. LIDS WERE TIGHTENED TO PREVENT FURTHER SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. ITEMS WERE THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT LINED DRUM.

DescribePack: OUTER CARTON WAS WET DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. CAPS LOOSENED DURING TRANSIT DUE TO INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING (NO INNER PACKING) WHICH CAUSED CONTENTS TO SHIFT AND LOOSEN CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SHIPMENT WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT LINED TOTE TO CONTAIN ANY SPILLAGE. ONLY THE TOP OF THE CARTON WAS WET.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During outbound, at around 8:30pm, a manager reported damaged hazmats that were discovered by a splitter on van line 3. The belt was shutoff; I immediately place the two leaking hazmats as well as the hazmats they leaked on in totes lined with plastic bags. I cleaned up the corrosive spills with paper towels. The hazmats were placed in QA1. DescribePack: The Jerrican has a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and tote.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload area of the building. The unload manager said that the shipment fell off of the rollers onto the ground and a wet spot was noticed on the exterior packaging. DescribePack: One of the four bottles has a crack on the body of the bottle. It is very small and hard to see. The ISF has a picture of it, but it's hard to tell that the bottle is cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: An Admin contained the leaking shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

Report X-2023110728

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023110728 SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered on the load side of the building. The manager responsible called out the damage to an Admin, and the Admin contained the damage and took it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a loose lid. The wet spot on the exterior of the packaging was aligned with the bottle with the loose lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: An Admin contained the shipment in a hazmat spill tote right after the discovery of the damage. X-2023110730 SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload, so the unload manager called out to an Admin. The Admin contained the shipment in a hazmat spill tote and took it to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: The leakage was caused from a loose cap on one of the four bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin to the leakage contained the shipment in a hazmat spill tote right after being notified of the damage.
